intro: Primula mutabilis, commonly known as the variable primrose, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, yellow, and orange, depending on environmental conditions. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or alpine habitats. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
